events_page.preface: This upcoming academic year, we have several projects lined up. We would like to know if you are interested in participating in any of them.

events.title: UP ACM Fest
events.description: UP ACM's anniversary celebration, usually featuring talks from industry professionals and a game day for members (typically held in March or April).

events.title: Algolympics 2026
events.description: Our flagship event and a national coding competition, likely held around February 2026.

events.title: Easy as Py
events.description: A community-building event where we teach high school students basic Python.

events.title: UP ACM Elections
events.description: Join an ad hoc committee in charge of organizing the election of officers.

events.title: teACh Me
events.description: An internal event focused on upskilling and skills transfer between members and invited speakers on topics such as computer science, time management, financial planning, and selected hobbies.

events.title: SIGs (Special Interest Groups)
events.description: Groups focused on specific topics such as AI and web development, where members work on mini-projects for their portfolio.

events.title: ACMeets
events.description: Hangout sessions with ACM members, including brown bag sessions, sportsfests, gaming, watch parties, and more.

interests.question: Are you interested in being the Easy as Py project head?
interests.description: You do not need to be the Education head or a member of the Education committee to participate. If you have a passion for teaching and want to gain leadership experience in handling a smaller event, this is for you. Answering "yes" does not serve as a final commitment—it is simply an interest check. If you have questions about the responsibilities involved, feel free to ask any council member.

interests.question: Are you interested in being the Algolympics project head?
interests.description: Do you want to gain experience in handling a large-scale coding event? Answering "yes" does not serve as a final commitment—it is simply an interest check. If you have questions about the responsibilities involved, feel free to ask any council member.

interests.question: Do you have experience with frontend and/or backend development?
interests.description: We are looking for members who would like to help maintain our website. While the website is already live, we may need help with updates for events such as Algolympics and others. This role will serve as the web master, and members in this role may be exempt from heavier event workloads, as their primary responsibility will be website-related.

interests.question: Do you have experience with Cloud Technologies? (AWS)
interests.description: We are looking for people who are up for the challenge of cloud hosting our competition platforms for Algolympics.

interests.question: Operations Ad Hoc Committee
interests.description: The operations ad hoc committee is a separate committee designed to give portfolio-ready projects to work on. Develop tools and forms that help streamline or automate operations within the organization. Note that being a part of the operations ad hoc committee won't exempt you from your regular committee responsibilities.

teachMe.title: teACh Me
teachMe.question: What topics would you be interested in joining for teACh Me
teachMe.description: * teACh Me is a 1–2 day workshop where you get to dive into a topic you’re curious about. You’ll be working hands-on and walking away with something cool you can show off or keep building on. Since our instructors put a lot of effort into running these workshops, we do ask for commitment for the full duration, but trust us, it’ll be worth it.

membership.question: Are you g to be a buddy for this coming app process?
membership.description: A buddy will be an applican't point person and hopefully first friend to help them with their app process

membership.question: What kind of activities do you want to see for ACMeets?
membership.description: Examples: Review sessions, Sportsfest, Food trip sa A2, etc.

membership.question: Are you interested in joining a sportsfest?
membership.description: Sportsfest is an ACM event where members will participate in any sports-related activites

membership.question: Are you G for face to face activities?
membership.description: Examples: Review sessions, Sportsfest, Food trip sa A2, etc.

membership.question: Does your computer/laptop have a dedicated GPU
membership.description: This is to sense if the computers of ACMems are capable of running potential games for game nights.

membership.question: A skill I would like to learn this semester is...
I'd tambay with UP ACM if What would make you join org events? (even non-official or chill/hangout events)
Kindly list the multiplayer games that you currently play & willing to play with ACMems (i.e. Valorant, Fortnite, Minecraft)

records.question: Are you interested in helping Records for this sem's Automaton?
records.description: Automaton is a newsletter / trivia posts, all about general tech, computing, ACM, and more. We're looking for individuals interested in research and writing to help us! You can look at UP ACM's FB page back in 2022 for some examples.

records.question: Please upload a copy of your Form 5
records.description: This will be used for our organization recognition application for the College of Engineering. If your Form 5 is not yet available, you may choose to edit this Google Form later or submit it to Syrelle (Membership Head) later.

records.question: Please upload a copy of your UP ID (If you don't have one yet, any ID will do.)
records.description: This will also be used for our organization recognition application.

logistics.question: What is your download speed (in Mbps) based on speedtest.net?
What is your upload speed (in Mbps) based on speedtest.net?
What type of gadgets do you own?

education.question: What classes do you still have pending requirement in?
education.description: Please separate each subject with a comma and a space.

education.question: What classes are you expected to take this semester?
education.description: Please separate each subject with a comma and a space.

publicity.question: Attach a picture of you that you would like us to use in our pubs!
publicity.description: This would be used in official UP ACM Publicity Materials. Please upload a good-looking picture of yourself! If you don't upload a photo, we will choose a photo of you at our own discretion.
publicity.notes: Upload 1 supported file: image. Max 10 MB.

publicity.question: Do you want to be greeted by Jammond in the ACM Resident GC on your birthday?

marketing.question: Are you willing to disclose your personal information to UP ACM's company sponsors/partners?
marketing.description: This includes name, year level, course, and email address. The goal is to connect members with internship or job opportunities.

marketing.question: Attach your RESUME / CV below
marketing.description: Alternatively, you may submit your RESUME/CV by emailing it to marketing@upacm.net with the SUBJECT: LASTNAME RESUME/CV.
marketing.notes: Upload 1 supported file: PDF. Max 10 MB.

marketing.question: Are you available for face-to-face meetups should certain companies request for it?
marketing.description: Meetups will likely be around UPD/Katipunan area.

options.title: Yes, I am willing to attend.
options.name: companyf2f

options.title: No, I would prefer it to be an online call.
options.name: companyf2f

public_relations.question: Would you be willing to participate in liking/sharing for partnership responsibilities?

options.title: Yes, for computing related events only
options.name: partnership

options.title: Yes, for events hosted by engineering organizations only
options.name: partnership

public_relations.question: How many posts a month would you be willing to like/share for partnerships (excluding UP ACM events)?
